meanings.definition: Past tense of 'whist': to be silent or make little noise.
meanings.sent1: The children whisted during the movie.
meanings.sent2: The library was whisted as everyone focused on reading.
meanings.sent3: The cat whisted as it stalked its prey.
meanings.sent4: The forest whisted with the sound of rustling leaves.
meanings.sent5: She whisted a secret to her friend, hoping no one else would hear.

meanings.sent1: The whisted room allowed for peaceful rest.
meanings.sent2: The whisted night sky was filled with twinkling stars.
meanings.sent3: The whisted mouse tip-toed across the floor.
meanings.sent4: The whisted snowfall covered the town in a blanket of white.
meanings.sent5: His whisted demeanor made him a good listener.

meanings.sent1: She moved whisted through the house to avoid waking anyone.
meanings.sent2: The ninja moved whisted through the shadows.
meanings.sent3: The wind whisted through the trees on the calm night.
meanings.sent4: The snow fell whisted from the sky, covering the ground.
meanings.sent5: He spoke whisted, not wanting to disturb the peace of the room.
